detail.content: Institute for the History of the Production of Knowledge | New York University                                   NEW YORK UNIVERSITY       ARTS AND SCIENCE       COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SCIENCE       GRADUATE SCHOOL OF ARTS AND SCIENCE                                                                                Home     People       Research Projects       Course Offerings       Events       Resources             Stay Connected           Twitter                 What is the IHPK?   Founded at New York University in 1997, the Institute for the History of the Production of Knowledge (IHPK) is a non-degree-granting initiative designed to encourage faculty and students to explore the changing configurations of disciplines, methodologies, and technologies that have shaped knowledge in the ancient and modern worlds. By developing seminars and workshops that examine the history of these configurations, the Institute also supports experiments with new constellations of subject matters and texts, innovative methodologies, and interrogations of existing departmental and divisional organization within this and other universities.                     Research Projects           Anthropology and its Publics   With the help of a group of graduate students from NYU, CUNY, and elsewhere, a print and web based magazine called Anthropology Now is being published under the auspices of the IHPK by Paradigm Publishers.     Read More ...         The Psy-ences Project   The Psy-ences Project is a regional seminar, launched by Elizabeth Lunbeck (History, Princeton), Emily Martin (Anthropology, NYU), and Louis Sass (Clinical Psychology, Rutgers)     Read More ...                                     Contact Us | © New York University , Arts and Science
